content.description:
This a link up starting on the first 3 bolts of the Old and the Ugly and finishing on the last two bolts of Middle Age Madness. Bypasses the cruxes on both routes to produce a super juggy and steep 5.11 with great flow. Provides an excellent warm up for the harder routes in the cave.



Starts up chossy ledges just to the right of Middle Age Madness.


5 bolts with fixed chain draws and lower offs makes cleaning a cinch. Resist the temptation to clip fourth bolt of MAM as it will result poor flow.

head up to pull little roof search for holds...what was once thought to be a possible good warm up turned out to not be. on the bouldery side. suprisingly sustained. Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)
HEad North through the boulders in the woods, trail meanders through the classic rock boulders  last boulder will be on your right (classic slab) and trail will continue left ,   winding up hill  once at top of hill the trail leads along side a very large boulder, . Parkland Crag will come into view through the trees 15 min , hike to right past Parkland continuing up hill, trail will continue around the bottom of small cliff that is wet or waterfall most of the yr, trail will take you to far left end of cliff, cliff conitnues right going around massive fir tree(please protect) to all centre right routes. bolts

Start on arette, crips, jugs, a sloper and vertical...everything you could ask for

bolt

Not the best warm up but it will have to do. easier if you move around Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

The next set of routes start off the ledge,  trail passes around large fir tree to get to base  I wouldn't try to scramble up to ledge super choss nothing was cleaned off that. 8 "Danger" STICK CLIP FIRST BOLT  Start in corner off ledge, leading up fun holds , route steepins and holds get smaller before pulling a final roof Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

The first route on roof as you approach cliff its distinct as it follows a thin featured seem that Heads straight up steepest part of the roof Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

The next set of routes start off the ledge,  trail passes around large fir tree to get to base  I wouldn't try to scramble up to ledge super choss nothing was cleaned off that. -  "Danger"STICK CLIP FIRST BOLT.  Difficult start to a big jug, to  hard steep finish .( Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

"DANGER, stick clip start just right of sherrifs Vag ,move onto giant horn then big move to sloper  continue climbing to top, some bolts are hard to see but rest assured they are there Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

The next set of routes start off the ledge,  trail passes around large fir tree to get to base  I wouldn't try to scramble up to ledge super choss nothing was cleaned off that. STICK CLIP FIRST BOLT. another steep sustained climb. Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

"DANGER, stick clip  scramble up choss for first bolt then make your way up left to big rail , after second bolt dino for a good jug. remains difficult to top, one bolt is hidden over lip, chains to right after last bolt Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

Steep and savage looking roof with another difficult boulder problem over the lip.

Info provided by Tyler Southam



Bolted line right of Elitpisst and starts on and moves out left of The Sheriff's Vadge.

bolts

Start in broken stepped rock at base of roof, head right steeply towards orange colored rock and giant "rest horn". good holds till there then steep difficult crux, easier climbing once you pull roof.  Great fun overhanging route. Belayer has some good photo vantage points. Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

Follow arete steep technical sustained interesting climbing.  A must do! climbs.name: Squampton Sticker on a Rollls Royce

content.description:
-  Lead up featured wal to a roof with good holds, vertical to finish Turn down Powerhouse Spring FSR off of Mamquam fsr, head down hill , after road veers right you will see a wet land on your right side, just pass this you will see a large boulder 10m off road on your left, 0.6 km from Mamquam FSR. park here (this is the "classic rock" boulder field)

"Valleycliffe Heights" (VCH) is another addition of Sport climbing to the crumpit woods area, located 20 min up hill from Powerhouse springs FSR
